bow: seriously just ca do it anymore my daughter who will be 12 weeks on monday has literally cried nonstop since the day she was born ve tried everything from gas drops to gripe water to cutting out dairy completely do know what is wrong with her but it is making me lose my mind try to get break from the constant crying but my husband has such short fuse and the moment she begins crying he starts freaking out and yelling so have to take her get no break no support and all this pressure is on me to be the patient one and calm her down honestly do know what to do anymore it making me hate my life and the worst feeling in the world is feeling resentment towards little human when it not even her fault please help me edit truly appreciate everyone advice and comforting words told my husband that he needs to get anger management and he blew it out of proportion and stormed out on me everyone input will definitely help me to figure out how to do this on my own so thank you you re just about through the 4th trimester hang in there little bit longer hopefully things will get easier soon parenting is no joke but you re doing great do you have *anyone* you trust who you can ask to give you break even if it for an hour nap lot of times it hard to reach out and say ca do this but you need to give yourself little break to recharge your husband needs to grow up and find way to raise his daughter yelling at her is productive he needs to let you step away few hours day even if only intermittently you get 30 mins to shower and dress peacefully no interruptions unless it true emergency another 30 twice day to eat an actual meal you get to sleep which means if you re nursing he brings baby to you before he gets back to sleep does matter if he needs to work the next day you re working 24 it nearly impossible to raise an infant 100 alone and your husband is holding up his end of the bargain it not mommy job to settle crying baby it mommy and daddy job this is negotiable neighbor aunt or uncle cousin lean on anyone else you can to get bit of rest see baby doctor to rule out any medical issues but at 12 weeks baby may just be purple crying or hungry or growing it hard work for baby too good luck what is she eating formula or bm are you co sleeping wish could help you are you anywhere near central pennsylvania its so hard when the baby just keeps crying and crying and there no end to it and no help for you my husband has short fuse too even though our son is nearly two he still gets frustrated easily he just has got the innate patience that baby or toddler needs he does try though which is what think your husband should do he owes it to you both to try take the baby for drive or hold them while they cry for long enough for you to get something to eat or take shower when our somn was baby and would just cry and cry and couldnt get him to stop it felt like my nerves were raw and just couldnt take much more would try to add in other noise be it the vaccuum or music or the car or the shower anything to just give my ears and my nerves break for minute some times it felt mean and would upset him more but sometimes it helped and he liked it but either way it gave me break from the heart piercing cries is there anyone at all that you can go and see friend or relative anyone that you can talk to in person who can give you face to face support if you dont have anyone who can help support you in person try and reach out to your local moms groups there are mops groups all over the states theyre christian based but very welcoming and really nice even if youre not or something that really helped us was group called hike it baby https hikeitbaby com take look for your local chapter they are all about getting your kids outside and supporting moms of kids of all ages would wear my son in the carrier and he would cry and cry and they were all moms so they got it and there was no judgement it was so nice to have other moms to talk to and to just be outside of the house even if he was shrieking the whole time and often he would eventually fall asleep in the carrier from walking and would get some peace please pm me if you want if you need someone to talk to remember the guilt of resenting my baby for crying when it wasnt his fault at all wish could say something that would help were here for you mama she breastfed and we cosleep only an hour or two try to keep her in her pack play next to the bed more often than in the bed wish it was that easy ve tried telling him how productive yelling at an infant is much rather deal with the crying than watch his angry attempts at calming her it makes it harder that we re both military and none of our family lives in town feel your pain the first couple of months are hard ca help you but do wan na say it gets easier eventually is there anyone else who can maybe watch the baby for an hour so you can have moment of peace what helped my kiddo to stop crying was to wear her carry her around in one of those cloth wraps and know this goes without saying but whatever you do dont hurt the baby out of frustration if you feel anger boiling up put the baby in safe place and take minute breather also have you talked to family doctor about her crying they might be able to pin point reason for it honestly it hard asking for help when know how much she cries just do think people would want to deal with that military so we live away from family unfortunately hand him the baby and leave for three hours tell him it baby boot camp he is the parent make it work do it again daily until he figures stuff out it lazy cop out for him he does have to do anything does have to correct harmful behavior and can blame you for everything if he inclined that not acceptable the military does have social groups where you are moms dependents heck religious join them and get help if you can but it must start at home the baby is only your responsibility it is both of yours and the sooner your husband learns that the better you ll both be sorry but just ca stand reading about men who ca cope with baby while expecting women to do everything it abusive how long have you cut out dairy it can take weeks to get the dairy proteins out of your milk for my son had to give up dairy and eggs really pro breastfeeding for myself was in the icu for week after my daughter was born an forced myself to pump every hours and had family bring her to me times day when was off the ventilator so understand if its something really important to you but maybe try formula for few days or week to see if it helps you need rest hand pumps sent expensive so you could keep your milk supply second the doctor visit too be firm and tell them this is not normal newborn crying honestly the crying sound worst to the mom you ve dealt with it for weeks someone well rested can deal for while had colicky baby and tried to be martyr now gladly deal with someone colicky baby to help out my son was colicky too and had the same thought remember the crying is primed to bother you more than anyone else also had the same problem with husband we re on number now and second the baby boot camp idea my husband is much babies are hard if she going to cry anyways at least give yourself breather and definitely try to rule out reflux removed cut out dairy for nearly month saw little if any change when confided in her id=282414 my husband and started our family while we were stationed overseas the pressure is real the isolation is real you can do it it takes village use all the resources available it never too when would you be comfortable with cdc or fcc none of this will help with crying but you will find support among other parents you wo feel so alone or helpless and that goes long way fully support all magic have twins and swear by it the tldr is the swaddling swinging sucking shhhhh and side swaddle her give her pacifier breast your nail down finger to suck on gently jiggle her head via swing one of your hairs wrapped around finger or toe or anything else poking or hurting her then do these things if it all fails start all over again if you ever feel you or your husband my harm your time bonding with baby are you in virginia if so would be happy to help first few weeks are very tough but things do get better if you can get your husband to attend baby classes that might help him have guidance on what to do that comes from professional would try talking when he calm and the baby is crying if you can find moment and being very plain about what the consequences are for being rough with an infant am sure he ll be horrified maybe upset that that how close it getting hopefully it will be enough to snap away his attitude remind him it ok to put the baby down and walk away for mins to calm down too but emphasize you need him to be able to do this have you tried tv know some people bet against this but mickey mouse clubhouse made my little one stop crying instantly would go to the pediatrician the try chiropractor it made my baby go from hours of crying day to 10 minutes if you are in georgia can help you out very used to crying babies you just need break and to get some sleep nails done how can we help you removed my daughter cried so much around the same age switched her to nutramigen due to milk protein allergy and it made world of difference also downloaded an app on my phone think it was called baby sleep sounds or something and would put it on the vacuum sound it calmed her down when would play it and give her pacifier the nutramigen is more expensive but give it try and see if you notice difference know it sounds cliche but it will get better promise the only other thing that helped was taking my daughter outside for few minutes not sure if it was the temperature change or new things to look at but it would help even if for only minutes the main ideas are on youtube too our library had copy of the dvd but inside youtube for refreshers colic is so hard had all the resources in the world and still had terrible time with my second kid and his colic my ped said as others have said that its ok to put the baby down for min of your frustration is dangerously high can you get mothers helper young teens can come in and watch the baby while you rest in the same house its cheaper and easier than sitter also wearing my kid helped immensely the beco has an infant insert and he really did cry as much when wore him did give up dairy and switched to soy formula we did both take care of yourself its the longest shortest time honestly maybe he needs anger management my mom took anger management classes and said it was incredibly helpful you re in the trenches and it so hard right now it will get better and hopefully soon but until then recommend cosleeping if you re comfortable with it was against it hardcore and then met my breaking point and it was lifesaver it might be hard to transition to the crib later but it worth it imho as long as you read up on doing it safely also try wearing earplugs when you are bothered by the crying it helps you stay calmer think clearer and it improves your patience by lot you re still paying attention to baby needs but without the stress and sky high heart rate good luck mama something that helped me when felt lonely was knowing that somewhere in the world in that same moment there was another new mom with crying baby who felt the same as me know it sounds crazy but would send thoughts out like hope that other mom gets some good sleep soon or hope her baby stops fussing and would think about how it possible that another mom was doing the same for me even ll be sending positive thoughts your way she would end up pumping for about five weeks when cut out dairy saw some relief in week once was truly df come to find out my probiotic also had dairy in it wtf but it really did take five weeks to see the full effect there are myriad of ways dads can bond with baby that do include feeding baths rocking babywearing skin to skin my husband is well bonded with our child and he has rarely fed her bottle she only took them for 30 hours when was re hospitalized know many families who swear by chiropractics for babies please do your research and find one that is well recommended they personally make me nervous but as said many families swear by it any chance you re stationed in the 757 ll hold her for few hours so you can refresh you are pushed to the limit and leaning on some resources locally can make world of difference sending hugs removed is she hungry you mentioned you re be frustrating your husband and causing more anger really hope you can both find some support just know that we re all thinking of you and praying it improves xx my son just turned one and cried for the majority of his first few months know this does sound encouraging but promise you it gets better and easier to deal with the crying may not stop but you get stronger every day little by little was in the same boat of feeling like could ask anyone to watch my baby knowing how much he cried but finally realized that they will only deal with it for few hours was doing it for days and weeks so if you can find friend or someone you trust it is completely ok to make them sit with your crying baby for few hours they may not offer again but at least you got little break hang in there you can do it mine still stops immediately when she hears doc mcstuffins both mine were like this my second worse than the first it was milk protein allergy cutting out dairy was enough because even cooked dairy in your diet can transfer to them there stool test the doctor can do to check for the allergy would highly suggest you get your little one tested for the milk protein allergy and some others too both my kids had it as infants but most kids grow out of it by 12 months few weeks on hypoallergenic formula my son drank similac alimentum and my daughter drinks enfamil nutramigen basically the same thing and they were completely different babies happy calm not crying 24 sleeping for decent stretches pooping without pain eating without arching straining or grunting zantac for the reflux also helped both my kids lot my daughter is months now and sooo much better she cried 24 from about weeks until 12 weeks she started the formula at weeks and needed full weeks on it to feel significantly better my first had only needed two weeks to feel better those weeks were completely understand how you are feeling right now there were many times just had to put them down and go scream or cry at the other happy to carry your baby around for while while you relax but agree dad needs to get his anger under control or see about some anger management yes it frustrating to not understand why baby is crying for both parents but he needs to understand too that you need time to get away also it exhausting going to throw some advice out to you but some people think it crazy lol have you considered visiting chiropractor mean for your little one absolutely swear by it especially when my newborns can not be settled ve had my sil also took her colicky baby to the chiropractor and she was better after couple treatments the treatments are as scary as it sounds sometimes when babies are being born their little spine goes out of alignment having something out of alignment can slow digestion and cause colic issues the treatments are very gentle most of the time and baby is usually sleeping and will remain asleep during an adjustment feel free to pm me if you have any questions you ve got lot of great answers here let me just say was in similar boat now my baby is months almost and he is getting calmer and calmer there is light at the end of the tunnel some things that helped me cut out dairy and wheat keeping food journal to see if in need to cut out anything else manage his sleep like banshee no grandma you ca hold the baby because he is asleep sleep begets more sleep had some serious conversations with my husband when said baby was asleep gave my husband job to do specifically for him he does diaper changes when he is around and gets the baby ready for sleep pjams reading book etc it their bedtime routine so showed him the research and let him pick out what he wanted to do that let them bound for your husband would recommend counseling the military has good resources use them stopped caring about the house and shut my eyes when they baby slept or did something else to rejuvenate me went online and found local support groups la leche league local mom baby hike it group etc know if it was just being with someone different or what so you never know reach out give it try was in this situation when my girl was born she will be on the 2nd my hubby could cope with the crying we discovered it was almost like ptsd from when his mother left his sister crying for hours and hours when he was 10 he would get instantly angry and just shouted at the baby or just talk angrily at the baby so always took the baby when she cried know how hard it is it caused me to have ppd that still recovering from and feel this will be my only baby hubby still struggles with it he is getting better so can have break occasionally what helped for me baby wearing tried the sling but went with big wrap my girl grew quick and learnt to wrap safely so when she was very young she could lay and when she was older she would be sitting she basically slept on me during the day for months either being held or in the wrap had naps when she slept with me used my breast feeding pregnancy pillow to prop myself up on the sofa so my girl was safe approved by my midwife you do nothing else apart from deal with the baby if he ca cope then he can do everything else cooking cleaning nappy changes shopping taking baby for walk bottles etc they gives you some mini breaks had my mum stay with me for few weeks just so could have break occasionally try different brands of gas drops some make the bubbles go small some large so they pass each doctor will recommend something different you just have to try them in the end infracol works for us teetha granules it chamomile it helps with teething tantrums and colic if your baby is having crying fit and nothing is calming then down try giving them this with the dummy it enough to break the cycle tummy massages helped lot you can buy baby tummy balms or just use baby oil it just helps the gas move leg movements when changing nappies think of it as an exercise video with your babies legs bicycle and pushing the knees into the tummy gently helps move the gas bottles we got ones that have an outlet for extra air we never tried colic ones that all can think of at the moment hope it helps in any way it does get better it is for relativity short period of time but it is an eternity until it gets better hang in there and talk to your hubby he maybe suffering from ppd but get him to do everything else men can struggle with the blob stage hug to you feel helpless sometimes as well hope it gets better soon has he tried some ear plugs hear those can be really helpful for dealing with constant crying once you know baby is crying you do necessarily have to keep listening to it especially at full volume while you are meeting their needs also read great article about colic recently that can try to find this article was posted on babybumps last week and it was an interesting read maybe it could help with your constantly crying little one plan to try with baby https www babydoc com au faq colic bore your baby to sleep constant ceying can be gerd dd had gerd and we had to switch her to protein washed formula and give her acid medicine until she was once she stopped feeling her insides burning up she became pretty happy there are resources on base that you can contact cdc does drop in daycare him screaming at the baby scares me ca even describe how much this scares me we had guy at one of our last bases lose it throw his infant daughter against wall please contact family health your daughter and both you and your husband would benefit from finding some help please do feel ashamed that you need to ask parenting newborn is hard sorry you re going through this there nothing harder than feeling alone in difficult situation below are few things that came to mind for you to check into if you have already lip tie tongue tie is very often missed even by drs there is even type that hidden you can google around about it but it causes improper latch and the baby not getting enough milk causing fussiness do you have pain when you nurse does she seem satisfied after eating if she not then there good chance the issue is food related also do you find yourself nursing her for very long periods of time my cousin had this with two of her kids and the same day after they got their tongue tie clipped they were eating and happy is her poop frothy does she seem gassy you might have oversupply had this issue and all it took to fix was feeding her from the same side times until my supply went down bit when you have oversupply the baby gets too much of the watery foremilk and not enough of the fatty hind milk this results in general crankiness and etc etc if she has dairy intolerance often it recommended to cut out soy as well the baby ca digest the milk protein correctly causing problems but milk and soy have very similar protein structures also there are so many hidden sources of milk and soy there lists online had this with my daughter she even had streaks of blood in her poop and it took about weeks for things to even out also did it realize probiotic was taking was not dairy free you got ta check vitamins everything it may be worth keeping little log of when she starts crying and what happened before and after you may see pattern emerge you may just have sensitive baby in that case stay as calm and positive as you can and hold her do akin to skin babywear the closeness may comfort her sometimes the issue can be some combination of the above my 3rd lactation consultant was miracle worker if your insurance covers it you may find support and real help from one find something to join isolation is only going to drive you deeper into helplessness you can look up local chapter of la leche league it support group where breastfeeding moms get together and believe the leader has to go through some training nobody is more interested in solutions more than other moms with babies as christian believe me we are happy to see new faces in church if knew where you were might be able to recommend one but pastors wife should be pretty used to helping you do have to be member to get help bigger church might have more resources like mops group and has babysitting during services but smaller church might feel more personal anyone you can reach out to now is the time as for your husband that tough one if you feel unsafe you and the baby should leave if you feel ok but he does know how to handle his emotions it best to create some distance during stressful moments so you do feed off each other frustration there great book called boundaries by henry cloud and john townsend that will help you once you are able to read since right now it probably hard you ca control his behavior but you can control how much of it you expose yourself too talk to his family was he colicky baby maybe him hearing that he was like that may help him understand it all part of life you re fighting the good fight and you re doing your best that means you re great mom please update us when you can on how things are going have your post bookmarked air force in new mexico did try cutting out all dairy completely for weeks but when it was getting any better went back to eating normal have tried cutting out eggs though good to know about tricare one of the reasons really do want to give up bfing is because soy formulas can get really expensive so thanks for letting me know will probably attempt to get him to look into this we have been on the waiting list for the cdc since week after she was born unfortunately use playlist on you tube called little baby bum or lbb the one with the picture of the little ducks or twinkle twinkle little star work very well for the tiny ones the music is so soothing we have daycare and use this on laptop to help the little ones even young babies recover from meltdowns etc also had daughter that cried like that and heart defect was eventually discovered and repaired after being told countless times that the problem was me my nervousness was stressing her friend had the same thing and her daughter suddenly quit crying at the 4th month if you can do nothing and the music does help you or your daughter and the medical community can find nothing wrong suggest noise canceling headphones for both you and your husband to wear as you listen to something that works for you as you rock your little one had cousin like that as an infant and she had severe migraines all her life so her mother wonders if she was in pain as an infant as well also have read what everyone else has written and there are so many good ideas please accept any help you are able to get wish you guys the best where in new mexico if you re in albuquerque does your health plan cover any unm services even if it does unm does lot of sliding scale payments they have some great newborn and new mom services if you re in alamogordo not sure what available down there but could ask some friends really sorry you re going through this had *very* fussy baby who was diagnosed with reflux and it was still so hard my husband had very hard time learning how to be father he great dad but he just struggled in the early months he felt useless and like he sucked at being parent so he just could figure out how to help the baby was also emotionally mess and he could figure out how to help me eventually gave up bfing mixed results but it was the best choice for me and she did mellow out bunch by about 14 weeks thanks to the reflux meds and formula and us getting couples therapy it is so hard really feel for you third this look at connecta they re super easy to use and will give you hands free also go easy on yourself parenting is hard and newborn fog sleep deprivation screaming baby is killer my little one was pretty much glued to me for the first four months and baby wearing saved my sanity we can all give you all the advice under the sun but at the end of the day big believer in do what works whatever that may be to help your baby be happy and comforted and you happy and showered and fed try to block out people opinions hubbys included if he not going to be helpful take her to chiropractor too call doula and explain what happening and hire some help and babies are stressful but your husband needs either some anger management therapy or some infant parenting classes because he is not helping things it gets better you can do it
